      • create

        public static ExternalService create(ExternalServiceDefinition rServiceDefinition,
                                     Entity rUser,
                                     org.obrel.core.ProvidesConfiguration rConfig)
                              throws java.lang.Exception
        Factory method to create a new service instance of a certain type for a user.
        Parameters:
        rServiceDefinition - The type of service to create
        rUser - The user entity the service access shall be performed for
        rConfig - The configuration entity to read configuration values from
        Returns:
        The new service instance
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If the service creation fails

      • authorizeAccess

        public abstract java.lang.Object authorizeAccess(java.lang.String sCallbackUrl,
                                                 boolean bForceAuth,
                                                 java.lang.Object... rAccessScopes)
                                          throws java.lang.Exception
        Authorizes access to the external service. If the external service supports different access scopes these can be given in the second parameter. The returned value depends on the actual service implementation. Typically it can be expected to be one of the following types:
        • A URL: if the user needs to verify the request before the service access can be authorized. In that case the callback URL in the corresponding parameter will be invoked after the user has confirmed the request.
        • A string: The access token that authorizes the access to the service in subsequent requests.
        Parameters:
        sCallbackUrl - The callback URL to be notified if the user needs to manually verify the request before the service access can be authorized
        bForceAuth - TRUE to force the authorization even if cached authorization tokens or similar exist
        rAccessScopes - The optional access scopes
        Returns:
        Either a verification URL or an access token string
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If the authorization fails

      • createRequest

        public abstract ExternalServiceRequest createRequest(ExternalService.AccessType eAccessType,
                                                     java.lang.String sRequestUrl)
                                              throws java.lang.Exception
        Prepares a request to the external service.
        Parameters:

        sRequestUrl - The request URL
        Returns:
        The request object
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If creating the request fails

      • getCallbackCodeRequestParam

        public abstract java.lang.String getCallbackCodeRequestParam()
        Returns the name of the parameter that must be read from a callback HTTP request and then handed to the method processCallback(String).
        Returns:
        The name of the callback code request parameter

      • processCallback

        public abstract java.lang.String processCallback(java.lang.String sCallbackCode)
                                          throws java.lang.Exception
        Processes the response received through the callback URL of a call to authorizeAccess(String, boolean, Object...). IMPORTANT: This method must be invoked on the same service instance on which the authorization has been initiated.
        Parameters:
        sCallbackCode - sRequestParam The HTTP request of the callback
        Returns:
        The access token string received by the callback
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If the processing fails

      • revokeAccess

        public abstract void revokeAccess()
                           throws java.lang.Exception
        Revokes any previously authorized access of the current user for this service.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If revoking the access fails
